{"step_by_step_thinking": "The alveolar process is the part of the jaw that holds the teeth. It is generally thinnest in the front of the mouth, where the incisors are located. The lingual side refers to the side of the teeth that faces the tongue, while the buccal side refers to the side of the teeth that faces the cheek. The maxillary central incisors are the front teeth in the upper jaw, and the area lingual to these teeth is known to be the thinnest part of the alveolar process.", "answer_choice": "A. Lingual to the maxillary central incisors"}
